services.name: AI-Powered Rule Violation Detection
services.overview: This service leverages computer vision and machine learning to automate the detection of HOA rule violations. Residents can submit photos and videos through a mobile app or web portal, which are then analyzed by AI models to identify potential infractions such as unapproved property modifications, parking violations, pet restrictions, and landscaping issues. The system flags potential violations for review by HOA managers or board members, significantly reducing the time and effort required for manual monitoring and enforcement. The goal is to improve rule enforcement consistency, reduce administrative overhead, and enhance resident satisfaction by ensuring fair and efficient handling of violations.
problems_addressed: Time-consuming manual review of rule violation reports.
Inconsistent rule enforcement due to subjective human judgment.
Delayed response to violations, leading to escalation and dissatisfaction.
High administrative costs associated with manual violation monitoring.
Difficulty in tracking and analyzing violation trends.
core_features: Automated Violation Detection – AI-powered analysis of resident-submitted photos and videos to identify potential rule violations across various categories (parking, landscaping, modifications, pets, etc.).
Violation Categorization – Automatic classification of detected violations based on predefined HOA rules and categories for easy management and reporting.
Severity Assessment – Prioritization of violations based on severity levels, allowing managers to focus on the most critical issues first.
Automated Notification System – Generation and delivery of automated warnings and notices to residents upon detection of a rule violation, with customizable templates and escalation workflows.
Evidence Management – Secure storage and organization of violation reports, photos, videos, and related documentation for auditing and dispute resolution.

Reporting and Analytics – Comprehensive dashboards and reports providing insights into violation trends, hotspots, and enforcement effectiveness. Customizable dashboards will allow administrators to monitor compliance and enforcement activity.
Mobile App Integration – User-friendly mobile app for residents to easily submit violation reports with photos/videos from their smartphones.
Web Portal Integration - A secure web portal for HOA managers and board members to review violations, manage cases, and generate reports.
user_journeys: A resident observes a parking violation and uses the mobile app to take a photo and submit a report. The AI system analyzes the photo, confirms the violation (e.g., parking in a no-parking zone), and automatically sends a warning notice to the vehicle owner. The HOA manager reviews the case and can escalate if necessary. The entire process is tracked and documented in the system.

An HOA board member notices an unapproved modification to a property's landscaping. They submit the images through the admin portal. The AI identifies the changes as being outside of the approved guidelines. A notification is sent to the homeowner, with options to revert the changes or apply for post-approval.

An HOA manager reviews the monthly violation report to identify recurring issues in specific areas of the community. They use this data to implement targeted enforcement strategies and educational campaigns.
ai_capabilities: Computer Vision (CV) for image and video analysis to detect objects, identify patterns, and recognize rule violations (e.g., vehicle types, landscaping features, unauthorized structures).
Object Detection: YOLOv8 or similar models to detect relevant objects in images/videos (cars, pets, structures, etc.).
Image Classification: Custom-trained CNNs or fine-tuned pre-trained models (ResNet, EfficientNet) to classify violation types (parking, landscaping, modifications).
Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for reading license plates and identifying specific properties or units.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) for analyzing text descriptions provided by residents in violation reports to extract relevant information and context.
Anomaly Detection: Identify unusual patterns in resident submissions that may indicate fraudulent or malicious behavior.

Model Selection Notes: Consider using OpenAI's GPT models for NLP tasks, fine-tuning pre-trained CV models on HOA-specific violation datasets, and implementing vector search for similarity matching of violation reports.

input_data_types: Resident-submitted photos and videos (JPEG, PNG, MP4 formats)
HOA rule definitions (text or structured format)
data_schema_recommendations: Columns: violation_id (UUID), resident_id (UUID), property_id (UUID), violation_type (ENUM), date_reported (TIMESTAMP), photo_url (TEXT), video_url (TEXT), description (TEXT), status (ENUM: open, pending, resolved), severity (ENUM: low, medium, high), ai_confidence (FLOAT)
Columns: resident_id (UUID), first_name (TEXT), last_name (TEXT), email (TEXT), phone_number (TEXT)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) regarding the collection, storage, and use of resident data. Implement proper data encryption and access controls. Adhere to HOA-specific rules regarding privacy and the use of surveillance technologies. Obtain explicit consent from residents for data collection and usage.

required_integrations: HOA Management Systems (e.g., Buildium, AppFolio) for resident and property data synchronization.
Payment Gateways (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) for processing fines and fees.
Email Providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for sending violation notices and notifications.
SMS Providers (e.g., Twilio) for sending SMS notifications.
Analytics Tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) for tracking usage and performance.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API authentication. OAuth 2.0 for integration with third-party services. Consider Clerk or Auth0 for user authentication and authorization.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system will consist of a frontend (resident mobile app and web portal), a backend API (Node.js/Next.js), a database (PostgreSQL), a storage solution (Supabase storage), and an AI pipeline. The AI pipeline will receive images/videos from the backend, process them using CV/ML models, and return violation detections to the backend.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions, React Native (for mobile app)
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions, Express.js, TypeScript
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes and vector extensions for embeddings if needed
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing images and videos
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (for NLP tasks), TensorFlow/PyTorch (for CV/ML models), Pinecone/Supabase vectors (for vector search)
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend

API_design: POST /violations – Create a new violation report (payload: resident_id, property_id, photo_url, video_url, description)
GET /violations/{violation_id} – Retrieve a specific violation report
GET /violations – Retrieve all violation reports for a resident or property (query params: resident_id, property_id)
PUT /violations/{violation_id} – Update the status of a violation report (payload: status)
frontend_components: Violation Reporting Form – UI component for residents to submit violation reports with photos/videos and descriptions.
Violation Dashboard – UI component for HOA managers to view and manage violation reports, filter by status, severity, etc.
Property Viewer - Component that displays property details, resident information, and violation history
Interactive map - component that highlights violation hot spots, and allows users to zoom into specific properties and violations.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, STRIPE_SECRET_KEY, SENDGRID_API_KEY
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel, configure environment variables, and enable automatic deployments.
Build outputs: Next.js build output for frontend, Node.js serverless functions for backend, trained AI models for AI pipeline.
Runtime settings: Configure memory and CPU allocation for Vercel serverless functions. Optimize AI model inference for real-time performance.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of properties managed or the number of AI violation detections per month.
Usage-based pricing for additional AI processing beyond the included allowance.
Add-ons for premium features such as custom AI model training or integration with specific HOA management systems.

success_metrics: Reduction in manual review time for violation reports (measured in hours per month).
Increase in rule enforcement consistency (measured by variance in violation outcomes).
Improvement in resident satisfaction (measured by survey scores).
Number of violation reports processed automatically by AI.
Accuracy of AI violation detection (precision and recall).
Adoption rate of the mobile app and web portal by residents.
Number of active users and frequency of use.
